Faults.message:
We're aware of a fault on our local network affecting several homes. This means that you and some of your neighbours will be affected by the power cut, but not all - this is why you may notice some of your neighbours have power when you do not. Its not uncommon to see 1 in 3 homes affected.

Ourengineers are in your local area and working hard to get your power restored assoon as possible. At this stage, based on initial investigations, we're aimingto restore your power by 14:00 17/07/2025. If this changes, we willupdate this message.
Faults.name: SO16 Area

Faults.message:
We're aware of a fault on our local network affecting several homes. This means that you and some of your neighbours will be affected by the power cut, but not all - this is why you may notice some of your neighbours have power when you do not. Its not uncommon to see 1 in 3 homes affected.

Ourengineers are in your local area and working hard to get your power restored assoon as possible. At this stage, based on initial investigations, we're aimingto restore your power by 17:00 17/07/2025. If this changes, we willupdate this message.

The cause of this power cut is a fault on our underground network. This is the most common type of fault we see, and our teams are very experienced in dealing with these issues. In most cases, our engineers are able to get your power back on by simply replacing a fuse at the local substation, however, if the fault is severe, this may take us longer to fix. If this does happen, we will let you know.

If you need more information, please send us a message on Whatsapp or call us on 105 and quote reference 'RG6505'

Faults.name: PO38 Area

Faults.message:
We're aware of a power cut in the area shown, affecting 128 homes. This unplanned fault is affecting the local area, and it's likely several streets in the area are affected by the same power cut.

Wehave engineers on the way and they are due to arrive in your local area at09:30 17/07/2025. Once they arrive, they will get straight to workon investigating the fault and attempt to restore your power. We will continueto update this message with any new information. At this stage, we're aiming tohave your power restored by 15:00 17/07/2025.

We have had reports of damage to our network. When this happens, the power will automatically turn off to keep everyone safe. Our engineers know exactly where the problem is and are working hard to make the situation safe, repair the wire and get your power back on. These type of faults often require extensive work and specialist teams, such as tree cutters, which is why the restoration time seems so far away. If we can restore power sooner, we promise we will do so.

If you need more information, please send us a message on Whatsapp or call us on 105 and quote reference 'RG6691'

Faults.name: AB34 Area

Faults.message:
We're aware of a fault on our local network affecting several homes. This means that you and some of your neighbours will be affected by the power cut, but not all - this is why you may notice some of your neighbours have power when you do not. Its not uncommon to see 1 in 3 homes affected.

Ourengineers are in your local area and working hard to get your power restored assoon as possible. At this stage, based on initial investigations, we're aimingto restore your power by 15:00 17/07/2025. If this changes, we willupdate this message.

The cause of this power cut is a fault on our underground network. This is the most common type of fault we see, and our teams are very experienced in dealing with these issues. In most cases, our engineers are able to get your power back on by simply replacing a fuse at the local substation, however, if the fault is severe, this may take us longer to fix. If this does happen, we will let you know.

If you need more information, please send us a message on Whatsapp or call us on 105 and quote reference 'RG6646'

Faults.message:
We're aware of a power cut in the area shown, affecting 416 homes. This unplanned fault is affecting the local area, and it's likely several streets in the area are affected by the same power cut.

Wehave engineers on the way and they are due to arrive in your local area at14:20 17/07/2025. Once they arrive, they will get straight to workon investigating the fault and attempt to restore your power. We will continueto update this message with any new information. At this stage, we're aiming tohave your power restored by 16:30 17/07/2025.

The cause of this power cut is a fault on our overhead network. This is the most common type of fault we see, and our teams are very experienced in dealing with these issues. In most cases, our engineers are able to get your power back on by simply replacing a fuse at the local substation, however, if the fault is severe, this may take us longer to fix. If this does happen, we will let you know.

If you need more information, please send us a message on Whatsapp or call us on 105 and quote reference 'RG7461'
